intro: Oxygraphis, commonly known as the golden groundsel, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features yellow ray flowers surrounding a central disk, giving it a striking appearance. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Oxygraphis is often used in ornamental gardening due to its vibrant color and drought tolerance.
